TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit ObjectAce extends System.Security.AccessControl.QualifiedAce

Docs.summary: Controls access to Directory Services objects. This class represents an Access Control Entry (ACE) associated with a directory object.

MemberSignature.Value: public ObjectAce (System.Security.AccessControl.AceFlags aceFlags, System.Security.AccessControl.AceQualifier qualifier, int accessMask, System.Security.Principal.SecurityIdentifier sid, System.Security.AccessControl.ObjectAceFlags flags, Guid type, Guid inheritedType, bool isCallback, byte[] opaque);

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype System.Security.AccessControl.AceFlags aceFlags, valuetype System.Security.AccessControl.AceQualifier qualifier, int32 accessMask, class System.Security.Principal.SecurityIdentifier sid, valuetype System.Security.AccessControl.ObjectAceFlags flags, valuetype System.Guid type, valuetype System.Guid inheritedType, bool isCallback, unsigned int8[] opaque) cil managed

Docs.param: The inheritance, inheritance propagation, and auditing conditions for the new Access Control Entry (ACE).
The use of the new ACE.
The access mask for the ACE.
The <see cref="T:System.Security.Principal.SecurityIdentifier"> associated with the new ACE.
Whether the and parameters contain valid object GUIDs.
A GUID that identifies the object type to which the new ACE applies.
A GUID that identifies the object type that can inherit the new ACE.
`true` if the new ACE is a callback type ACE.

Opaque data associated with the new ACE. This is allowed only for callback ACE types. The length of this array must not be greater than the return value of the <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.ObjectAce.MaxOpaqueLength%2A> method.
Docs.summary: Initiates a new instance of the <see cref="T:System.Security.AccessControl.ObjectAce"> class.

Gets the length, in bytes, of the binary representation of the current <see cref="T:System.Security.AccessControl.ObjectAce"> object. This length should be used before marshaling the ACL into a binary array with the <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.ObjectAce.GetBinaryForm%2A> method.
Docs.value: The length, in bytes, of the binary representation of the current <see cref="T:System.Security.AccessControl.ObjectAce"> object.

MemberSignature.Value: public override void GetBinaryForm (byte[] binaryForm, int offset);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void GetBinaryForm(unsigned int8[] binaryForm, int32 offset) cil managed

Docs.param: The byte array into which the contents of the <see cref="T:System.Security.AccessControl.ObjectAce"> is marshaled.
The offset at which to start marshaling.
Docs.summary: Marshals the contents of the <see cref="T:System.Security.AccessControl.ObjectAce"> object into the specified byte array beginning at the specified offset.
Gets or sets the GUID of the object type that can inherit the Access Control Entry (ACE) that this <see cref="T:System.Security.AccessControl.ObjectAce"> object represents.
Docs.value: The GUID of the object type that can inherit the Access Control Entry (ACE) that this <see cref="T:System.Security.AccessControl.ObjectAce"> object represents.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the value of the <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.ObjectAce.ObjectAceFlags%2A> parameter does not contain the value <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.ObjectAceFlags>, this property is ignored.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig int32 MaxOpaqueLength(bool isCallback) cil managed

Docs.param: True if the <see cref="T:System.Security.AccessControl.ObjectAce"> is a callback ACE type.
Docs.summary: Returns the maximum allowed length, in bytes, of an opaque data BLOB for callback Access Control Entries (ACEs).
Docs.returns: The maximum allowed length, in bytes, of an opaque data BLOB for callback Access Control Entries (ACEs).

Docs.summary: Gets or sets flags that specify whether the <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.ObjectAce.ObjectAceType%2A> and <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.ObjectAce.InheritedObjectAceType%2A> properties contain values that identify valid object types.
Docs.value: On or more members of the <see cref="T:System.Security.AccessControl.ObjectAceFlags"> enumeration combined with a logical OR operation.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the GUID of the object type associated with this <see cref="T:System.Security.AccessControl.ObjectAce"> object.
Docs.value: The GUID of the object type associated with this <see cref="T:System.Security.AccessControl.ObjectAce"> object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the value of the <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.ObjectAce.ObjectAceFlags%2A> parameter does not contain the value <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.ObjectAceFlags>, this property is ignored.
